feed.title: SAP Community - SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud
feed.subtitle: SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: SAP Joule Introduction and its applications in SAP FICO
entry.content:
What Is SAP Joule?

SAP Joule is SAP‚Äôs AI copilot embedded across its cloud applications. It offers four interaction types‚ÄîTransactional, Navigational, Informational, and Analytical‚Äîthat let users perform business tasks via natural language within SAP environments. It understands user context, roles, permissions, and remains secure by design. It can also ground responses in your own business documents.

 How SAP Joule works in Public vs. Private Cloud is one of the most important considerations for finance teams (especially in FICO) deciding on adoption.

Here‚Äôs a structured view:

üîπ SAP Joule in Public vs. Private Cloud

  1. Deployment & Integration
  • Public Cloud (SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition)
    • Joule is natively embedded and updated by SAP automatically.
    • Integration with SAP FICO apps (GL, AP, AR, Asset Accounting, Controlling) is out of the box.
    • No additional installation required - users just activate and configure.
  • Private Cloud (SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition)
    • Joule can be enabled, but may require additional setup and integration.
    • Some Joule features might lag behind public cloud, because public gets innovations first.
    • Still integrates with FICO, but might require extra configuration & tenant connections to SAP BTP.
  1. Feature Availability
  • Public Cloud
    • Joule supports all 4 interaction types (Transactional, Navigational, Informational, Analytical) directly in Fiori apps.
    • Example in FICO: ‚ÄúPost vendor invoice‚Äù ‚Üí transaction executes directly.
    • Faster delivery of Joule Agents and Joule Studio.
  • Private Cloud
    • Informational & Analytical features available early (queries, reports, insights).
    • Transactional flows may require enablement through custom skills/agents.
    • Joule Studio can still be connected via SAP BTP, but adoption speed depends on customer‚Äôs upgrade cycle.
  1. Customization & Extensibility
  • Public Cloud
    • Limited custom coding‚Äîextensions must go through SAP BTP side-by-side development.
    • Joule skills/agents are mostly standardized.
    • Great if you want speed & standardization.
  • Private Cloud
    • More flexibility: you can create custom FICO processes, reports, and Joule agents.
    • Easier to integrate with on-prem or legacy systems.
    • Suited for companies with complex finance processes.
  1. Data Security & Residency
  • Public Cloud
    • Data is hosted on SAP-managed hyperscalers (AWS, Azure, GCP, SAP DCs).
    • Joule queries financial data via secure APIs; customers rely on SAP‚Äôs compliance.
  • Private Cloud
    • You control hosting, location, and more of the security stack.
    • Some finance-heavy industries (banking, defense, public sector) may prefer this for regulatory reasons.
  1. Upgrade & Innovation
  • Public Cloud
    • Quarterly upgrades ‚Üí Joule features arrive first and fastest.
    • Example: New Joule Agents for FICO tasks (like dispute resolution) appear immediately.
  • Private Cloud
    • Annual upgrades (with optional Feature Packs).
    • Joule features arrive later‚Äîinnovation follows public cloud by a few cycles.

üìä Comparison Table

Aspect

Public Cloud

Private Cloud

Availability

Native, out-of-the-box

Needs setup, later adoption

Updates

Quarterly, fastest innovations

Annual/controlled upgrades

Customization

Limited, BTP-based

Flexible, deep customizations

Security

SAP-managed hyperscalers

Customer-controlled

FICO Use Cases

Immediate transactional & analytical support

Strong for complex, regulated finance scenarios

Joule Studio

Fully available

Available via BTP, more flexible

‚úÖ Which is Better for FICO?

  • Public Cloud ‚Üí Best if you want rapid innovation, standard finance processes, faster AI adoption.
  • Private Cloud ‚Üí Best if you need deep customization, strict compliance, hybrid IT integration.

 SAP Joule version requirements for S/4HANA Cloud editions (Public and Private):

  1. SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
  • Joule arrived as part of the Public Cloud starting around Q3 2024, and is embedded in all releases thereafter, including 2408 (August 2024) and onward.
  • While Joule is built into these releases, you still need proper entitlement and authorization to use it; this may require activation via your SAP admin or account executive.
  • There are setup guides available detailing how to activate Joule once entitlement is granted.

In Summary:

If your system is on Public Cloud release 2408 (Aug 2024) or later, Joule is already supported‚Äîassuming you've got the right access and permissions.

  1. SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition
  • Joule is available in the Private Cloud as well, but requires setup and configuration. It's not automatically active‚Äîyou must enable it via SAP BTP and Joule Studio.
  • Technical prerequisites include ensuring the UI5 version in your system meets or exceeds the minimum required for Joule integration. The specific UI5 version will depend on your release; you can consult SAP documentation for exact details.

In Summary:

Private Cloud systems can support Joule‚Äîbut you must set it up, ensure the UI5 stack is compatible, and configure the feature via BTP.

  1. SAP S/4HANA On-Premise (Classic)
  • Joule is not supported on on-premise S/4HANA. SAP has confirmed it's not on the current roadmap for classic on-premise systems.
  • There‚Äôs a planned strategy‚Äîpossibly coming Q1 2025‚Äîto enable Joule via SAP Build Work Zone, BTP, and Joule Studio even for on-prem systems. But as of now, Joule remains unavailable on-prem and unsupported.

High-Level Overview

Edition

Supported from (release)

Requirements

Public Cloud

2408 (Aug 2024) onward

Needs entitlement/authorization & activation

Private Cloud

Post-2024 releases

Requires UI5 prerequisites + BTP/Joule Studio setup

On-Premise (classic)

Not supported (as of now)

No Joule availability; roadmap may include future BTP-based solution

Summary:

  • Public Cloud: Joule is supported starting with 2408 onward‚Äîactivate it via entitlement.
  • Private Cloud: Joule is available but not automatic‚Äîrequires UI compliance + setup via BTP.
  • On-Premise: Joule is not supported yet; no built-in version availability.

Here‚Äôs how SAP Joule, SAP‚Äôs generative AI assistant, can be applied specifically within the SAP FICO (Finance & Controlling) domain:

SAP Joule Application in FICO

  1. Transactional Interactions

Joule allows users to perform CRUD operations and manage financial documents via natural language‚Äîimagine asking:

  • ‚ÄúPost a vendor invoice of $5,000 to account X with due date Y.‚Äù
  • ‚ÄúShow me the status of PO invoice 10234.‚Äù
    While SAP hasn't yet released out-of-the-box FICO conversational flows, Joule‚Äôs transactional model supports this kind of interaction across cloud applications.
  1. Navigational Interactions

Instead of navigating through menus to reach Fiori apps like ‚ÄúDisplay GL Account Balances,‚Äù you could simply ask:

  • ‚ÄúWhere can I review G/L balances?‚Äù
    Joule will direct you to the relevant screen.
  1. Informational Interactions

Straight answers instead of digging through help docs. You can ask:

  • ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs the difference between cost center and profit center accounting?‚Äù
  • ‚ÄúExplain account determination for automatic postings.‚Äù
    Joule will deliver concise explanations, referencing SAP documentation or your own policy documents.
  1. Analytical Interactions

Joule bridges your natural-language queries to data analytics:

  • ‚ÄúShow me quarterly expense trends per cost center.‚Äù
  • ‚ÄúWhich cost centers exceeded budget last quarter?‚Äù
    It returns charts, metrics, or dashboards‚Äîleveraging SAP Analytics Cloud integration.

Advanced: Joule Agents & Studio

Joule Agents

SAP has introduced AI agents‚Äîautonomous actors capable of executing complex, multi-step workflows across business functions. In FICO, custom agents could:

  • Automate dispute resolution: Collaborate across finance and service teams to validate discrepancies and propose corrections.
  • Cash collection workflows: Analyze overdue invoices, coordinate with collections, and initiate follow-ups.
    These agents are part of SAP‚Äôs cross-functional automation strategy.

Joule Studio (within SAP Build)

No-code/low-code tool to create custom skills or agents tailored for your FICO needs:

  • Build a skill to automatically generate internal financial reports, or trigger approval workflows.
  • Automate vendor reconciliation or recurring postings by designing tailored AI agents.
    These skills and agents integrate across SAP and non-SAP systems.

Summary Table

Joule Capability

FICO Use Case Example

Transactional

Post invoices, check payment status via natural language

Navigational

Ask ‚ÄúWhere to view Cost Center Reports?‚Äù

Informational

Clarify financial terms or posting rules

Analytical

Generate trends and KPI charts using SAC

Agents & Studio

Automate dispute resolution, cash collection, approvals

Key Benefits in FICO

  • Boost Productivity: Save time by speaking instead of clicking through screens.
  • Reduce Errors: Leverage conversational clarity and auto-generated documents.
  • Improve Insights: Conduct data reviews and root cause analysis through simple dialogue.
  • Automate Complex Workflows: Agents handle multi-step tasks such as reconciliations or approvals automatically.

Real-World Usage Context -- Caveats

While SAP is rapidly developing Joule‚Äôs capabilities, many implementations remain in pilot or PoC stages. Users in forums report limited early usage, primarily for basic navigation or queries.

 

Here are concrete FICO scenarios where you could pilot SAP Joule and even extend it with Joule Agents / Studio:

üîπ Pilot Scenarios in SAP FICO

  1. Invoice & Payment Handling
  • Ask Joule:
    ‚ÄúPost an invoice for vendor ABC with $12,000 due in 30 days.‚Äù
  • Joule Action: Creates the posting, validates tax code, and confirms with you.
  • Extension with Agent: Automate follow-up‚Äîif payment not cleared by due date, Joule Agent triggers a reminder email or escalates.
  1. Month-End Close Assistant
  • Ask Joule:
    ‚ÄúWhat are the pending tasks for month-end close?‚Äù
  • Joule Action: Lists open items (accruals, GR/IR clearing, reconciliations).
  • Extension with Agent: Automate recurring accrual postings and send alerts to approvers who are late in providing confirmations.
  1. Financial Analysis & Insights
  • Ask Joule:
    ‚ÄúShow me expense trend per cost center for last 6 months.‚Äù
  • Joule Action: Returns a chart (via SAC integration).
  • Extension with Agent: Forecast next quarter‚Äôs expenses and flag cost centers that may exceed budgets.
  1. Audit & Compliance Checks
  • Ask Joule:
    ‚ÄúList journal entries above $50,000 in the last quarter without approvals.‚Äù
  • Joule Action: Generates a filtered list.
  • Extension with Agent: Create an automated internal audit agent that periodically checks for compliance exceptions and notifies controllers.
  1. Treasury & Cash Management
  • Ask Joule:
    ‚ÄúWhat is today‚Äôs cash position?‚Äù
  • Joule Action: Summarizes bank balances, incoming/outgoing payments.
  • Extension with Agent: Auto-generate a daily treasury dashboard at 9 AM and send to CFO.
  1. Dispute & Collections Management
  • Ask Joule:
    ‚ÄúShow me customers with invoices overdue > 60 days.‚Äù
  • Joule Action: Lists overdue accounts.
  • Extension with Agent: An AI agent sends personalized payment reminders and schedules calls with collections staff.
  1. Budget vs. Actual Control
  • Ask Joule:
    ‚ÄúWhich cost centers exceeded budget last quarter?‚Äù
  • Joule Action: Shows variances with drill-down.
  • Extension with Agent: Automatically notify budget owners when variances exceed a threshold (say 10%).

üîπ How to Design in Joule Studio

In Joule Studio (within SAP Build) you can:

  1. Create a Skill ‚Üí ‚ÄúGenerate quarterly P&L by company code and send PDF to finance team.‚Äù
  2. Create an Agent ‚Üí ‚ÄúMonitor overdue vendor payments and auto-initiate dunning.‚Äù
  3. Connect Non-SAP Apps ‚Üí e.g., send approvals via MS Teams or Slack.

üëâ This way, Joule moves from a copilot (answering queries) to a colleague (executing finance tasks for you).

 

Deep Dive on one of the real-world example: Vendor Invoice Posting with SAP Joule in Public vs Private Cloud.

üßæ Example: Vendor Invoice Posting with Joule

üîπ Scenario

A finance user wants to post a vendor invoice for Vendor 300012, amount $12,000, due in 30 days.

1Ô∏è‚É£ Public Cloud (SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition)

  • User says to Joule:
    üëâ ‚ÄúPost a vendor invoice of $12,000 for Vendor 300012, due in 30 days.‚Äù
  • Joule Process:
    1. Understands the intent (‚ÄúCreate Vendor Invoice‚Äù).
    2. Pulls relevant master data (Vendor 300012 details, tax code, payment terms).
    3. Pre-fills the invoice screen in Fiori.
    4. User confirms ‚Üí Invoice is posted.
  • Extras in Public Cloud:
    • Joule can immediately display the document number and due date schedule.
    • If connected to SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC), Joule can also show how this impacts cash outflow forecast.
    • Minimal setup ‚Üí available out-of-the-box.

2Ô∏è‚É£ Private Cloud (SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition)

  • User says to Joule:
    üëâ ‚ÄúPost a vendor invoice of $12,000 for Vendor 300012, due in 30 days.‚Äù
  • Joule Process:
    1. Joule recognizes intent, but instead of direct posting, it may:
      • Provide navigation ‚Üí ‚ÄúOpen FB60 (Vendor Invoice Entry)‚Äù or ‚ÄúFiori App: Create Supplier Invoice.‚Äù
      • Pre-fill metadata only if integrated with custom Joule Skill via Joule Studio.
    2. User manually confirms or adjusts in the classic posting screen (e.g., FB60 / MIRO).
    3. Invoice is posted.
  • Extras in Private Cloud:
    • You can customize Joule Agent (via Joule Studio + BTP) to enforce company-specific validations (e.g., block invoices >$10,000 without 2 approvals).
    • Joule can connect to legacy non-SAP apps (like OCR invoice scanners or in-house workflow systems).
    • Requires more setup & governance compared to Public Cloud.

üìä Side-by-Side Comparison

Step

Public Cloud

Private Cloud

Activation

Native, plug-and-play

Needs setup & integration

Invoice Posting

Joule executes directly in Fiori app

Joule suggests navigation, may require custom agent for automation

Data Validation

Standard rules auto-applied

Flexible, can embed custom compliance rules

User Effort

Minimal (voice/text ‚Üí posted)

Moderate (confirmation in screen, extra steps if no custom agent)

Analytics

Immediate cash flow impact via SAC

Possible, but may need manual SAC integration

Customization

Limited (SAP-standard process)

Flexible (custom workflows, approvals, legacy integration)

‚úÖ Takeaway:

  • In Public Cloud, Joule = speed + simplicity ‚Üí perfect for companies with standard finance processes.
  • In Private Cloud, Joule = control + flexibility ‚Üí better if you need extra compliance steps, custom posting logic, or hybrid integration.

Joule SAP S/4HANA Embedded Analytics SAP S/4HANA Finance SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Service SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition Sales

entry.title: Auto SES for Multiple PO Line items
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

Could someone help if there is any customization we can do in SAP S/4 Private cloud to enable or Automate Service Entry Sheet for multiple PO line items? Has anyone ever done this? I am aware there are multiple threads in this forum explaining about having one PO line and maintaining different service lines, but our business requirement is to have multiple PO line items, and each line item may have one or more services lines.

Any guidance on the program level changes if anyone has ever done would be very much appreciated. We are looking a way to automate the SES, may be a custom program by providing the Service PO number and the program can generate service entry sheets automatically based on the PO line items and the respective services lines in it.

Thanks,

Velu

SAP S/4HANA

entry.title: DEV System Refresh from PROD in RISE Private Cloud: Transporting ABAP Versions (130906) Feasible?
entry.content:
Hello,

We are planning to refresh our DEV system by copying from PROD, but we need to retain ABAP version management in DEV after the refresh.

SAP Note 130906 describes a process using R3trans to export the version repository before the refresh and import it afterward to preserve versions.

However, our landscape is on RISE with SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Private Edition. We have been told that this is not possible in RISE Private Cloud due to technical restrictions.

Therefore, I would like to ask:

1. Is it indeed not possible to perform version export/import (as recommended by Note 130906) during a DEV refresh from PROD in a RISE Private Cloud environment?
2. If it's not supported, is there an alternative approach recommended to preserve development versions during a system refresh on RISE Private Cloud?
3. Are there any official SAP statements, best practices, or notes regarding version management across system refreshes in RISE Private Cloud?

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Error fetching OData V4 services in VSCode
entry.content:
Hello,

I would like to publish an annotation driven Fiori application written in OData V4 through VSCode on a private cloud system. I published the service through /IWFND/V4_ADMIN and can see in ADT that the service binding is active and the preview is working.

I have added my system. When I test the connection I get the following messages in the console:

[info] This SAP System <XXX> returned 423 V2 and 0 V4 services.
[error] The V4 request failed with error: Request failed with status code 404.
 
I assume in this context that 404 stands for "not found". Does anyone have any idea where can I enable it?
 
All the best,
Ben

entry.title: Commerce Automation - MIRO Invoice to SAP Business network
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

Could someone please confirm, in Ariba Commerce Automation, do we have a scenario where we will be able to send the MIRO Invoice to SAP Business Network?

Per our understanding of the Standard Commerce Automation scenarios. When we send a PO to SAP Business network from S/4HANA Private Cloud ERP or SAP ECC. Supplier can submit the invoice from Network and that will create the Invoice in S/4 Automatically, this is standard and working perfectly fine for us. In this case, if the supplier submits a Paper invoice to AP team, can they create invoice through MIRO T.Code in SAP and send the invoice to SAP business network? Can some please confirm if this channel is available by standard?

The other channel for sending invoice from SAP to SAP Business network what we have seen is through the ERS (Evaluated Receipt Settlement), by this channel, once the PO is created with the ERS flag at the line-item level, the invoice will be generated in SAP through the MRRL T.Code and these invoices will have the ERS output type which will then be sent to Network. So our question is, to send invoices from SAP to SAP Business network, is this the only channel, can we not send the invoices from SAP to Business Network via the MIRO at all? 

Thanks,
Velu

#SAPS/4HANA

entry.title: How to fetch Profit Segment in FB60 Invoice posting in S4 Private Cloud
entry.content:
Hi there, 

I am in S4 Hana Private Cloud FPS 2023 Release 02 (Oct 2024). 

I need to post thru API JournalEntryCreateRequestConfirmation_In

I am able to post a simple Journal entry, without profit segment. If my expense line is hitting P&L account, I have Product and Profit Center, with which I need to derive Profit Segment for various COPA characteristics. How can I ensure I am passing all relevant fields within the API so the Profit Segment is deriving properly. 

When I pass the API thru Postman test for instance, I am succeeding to push the API, still, I am NOT seeing the document posted already. It takes a while to dig deep based on each type of error and trouble-shoot them one by one. 

I checked in other forums, I get different feedback that I am not clear, to determine what I am indeed missing. 

Can someone suggest appropriate steps in sequence, please? That would be helpful. 

Regards Siva

entry.title: SAP S/4HANA does not support automatic split purchase order by WBS code / storage location
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

We are currently working with SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud 2023  in a company that operates under a centralized purchasing model.

In SAP Business One, when creating a Purchase Order, if the items belong to different warehouses, the system automatically splits the PO into multiple purchase orders (one per warehouse). This is very useful for companies with centralized procurement but distributed warehouses/divisions, as it simplifies receiving and accounting at the warehouse level.

In SAP S/4HANA, I have observed that this functionality is not available by default. Instead, the system allows one PO to contain items for multiple plants/warehouses, and the logistics are handled separately.

üëâ My questions are:

  1. Is there a standard option/configuration in S/4HANA to achieve automatic PO split by warehouse/plant (similar to SAP Business One)?

  2. If not standard, what is the recommended best practice for centralized purchasing with bulk discounts and later distribution to different warehouses/divisions?

  3. Is the solution to use Stock Transport Orders (STO) or Central Procurement Hub after creating one bulk PO at the head office?

  4. Has anyone implemented a custom BAdI enhancement (e.g., ME_PROCESS_PO_CUST) to mimic this B1 functionality in S/4HANA?

This is a critical requirement for us since our business negotiates bulk discounts with suppliers and then distributes materials to multiple warehouses.

Any guidance, best practices, or experience sharing will be highly appreciated.

Thanks & Regards,

silambarasan RS

entry.title: which products are linked to the SAP RISE license (cloud public and private)
entry.content: could you provide me with details on which products are linked to the SAP RISE license and included within the package? cloud public and private

entry.title: Supplier Outgoing Payment Workflow process
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

I am working with SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud 2023, and we would like to understand how to properly set up the supplier outgoing payment workflow.

While exploring the Manage Automatic Payments app, I noticed that the process flow is quite lengthy (parameter generation, proposal editing, and payment submission). We created some simple workflow rules, and I have attached screenshots for reference.

However, in the authorizer‚Äôs decision-making screen, the user does not see the expected Release/Approve or Reject options.
Instead, the screen shows Open Task, under which only edit parameter actions are available (please see attached screenshot).

Could you please confirm if this is the standard behavior in S/4HANA Private Cloud for payment workflow?

If not, kindly guide me on the required configuration changes to enable the proper Release/Approve/Reject functionality.

Thank you in advance for your support.

Thanks & Regards,

silambarasan R

entry.title: Medical device stock to clinic and traceability for patient billing
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

We have a requirement from our customer who are into medical device manufacturing. The product is shipped to various clinics and hospitals for handover to the patients who are prescribed by the doctor. After the use for prescribed time the device is returned to the company for download of patient data. The invoice is raised after the patient data is downloaded by the company and shared with the clinic, hospital, patient themselves for the services as per any contractual terms (services is the report which is based on data downloaded from the device).

The device is serialized and the same device is used multiple times for different patients after which it becomes non operational and is disposed in controlled environment. (Since the company is FDA regulated)

My question to experts is as follows if someone has come across a similar scenario on any other project.

1) What would be ideal sales process for the product being sent to the hospital or clinic? (Consignment process? - May be too cumbersome for multiple hospitals or clinics to manage in SAP)

2) Once the product is returned back to the company for patient data download what would be the right process to keep track of the device which needs to be then used for a different hospital or patient for reuse? Any suggestions?

3) How to link the billing of the services (report based on download of patient data) with the device and the patient since the device was shipped to hospital or clinic (not directly to patient).

Any suggestion or pointers to any SAP documentation would be appreciated and helpful to find a suitable solution for our customer.

Thanks,

Kartik Shah

entry.title: WSDLs for SOAP APIs orderconfirmationrequest_in and orderrequest_out for SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud
entry.content:
Hi Experts!

Scope item 2EJ includes SOAP APIs for exporting purchase orders and importing order confirmations, deliveries and invoices.  When you go to the SAP Business Accelerator Hub (api.sap.com) and select SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition > APIs > SOAP you are able to search and find the documentation for the inbound delivery and inbound invoice, but the outbound purchase order and inbound order confirmation are not present.

The documentation for the purchase order and order confirmation (which includes the WSDLs) are needed in order to develop the BTP/Integration Suite iFlows to facilitate the exchange of these documents with external buyers.  If the documentation is not going to be listed on the SAP Business Accelerator Hub, where is it able to be found?

entry.title: Is BRF+ integrated with SAP Flexible Workflow for dynamic agent determination?
entry.content:
Hi SAP Community,

I'd like to understand whether SAP Flexible Workflow provides a standard/configurable integration with BRF+ for dynamic agent determination based on business rules, or if the only available approach is to invoke BRF+ through an agent determination BAdI such MMPUR_WORKFLOW_AGENTS_V2?

Any guidance would be appreciated.

Thanks,
Mustafa.

entry.title: on S/4HANA, if I use ADT to create custom CDS views, is it keeping the core clean?
entry.content:
Using ADT, if I were to create custom CDS views in S/4HANA on PCE or in S/4HANA on premise so I can create custom data products in SAP BDC, am I still keeping the core clean?   

Thanks.

Regards,

Mel Calucin

entry.title: Tooling Decision for S/4 Transformation - Need input
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

Hoping to tap into the collective wisdom of this community. We're just kicking off our S/4 transformation journey, and like many of you have probably experienced, we're navigating the maze of third-party tools.

Our focus right now is on custom code readiness. Our System Integrator has put forward SmartShift as their recommended solution for scanning our ABAP code. They're a known quantity, which is good.

However, I received what was likely a cold email from a company called Civra Research Labs. I checked out their site, and while it doesn't have the polish of a major vendor, I went through the demo of their AI-powered S/4 Readiness Scanner. Honestly, the tool itself looks pretty good and the AI-driven analysis does the job.

Here's the kicker: when comparing the proposed cost from our SI for SmartShift against Civra's pricing, SmartShift seems to be about 25 times more expensive. That's a huge difference.

So, I'm here to ask:

  1. Has anyone actually used tools from Civra Research Labs in a real project? I'm interested in their S/4 readiness, ABAP security scanner, or their Pen Testing Co-Pilot. What was your experience with the tool's quality, the results, and their support?

  2. On the other side, has anyone used SmartShift and felt the premium price was justified by the value delivered?

  3. Is a price difference this large a major red flag for the cheaper tool, or is it just a case of a newer player disrupting the market?

I'm looking for real-world, unbiased opinions to help us make an informed decision.

Appreciate any insights you can share.

(And a polite request: I'm looking for genuine user feedback, so no sales pitches or DMs from vendors, please.)

entry.title: Transfer of Planned independent Requirement from header level WBS to Lower level WBS
entry.content:
I am using 40 strategy type with WBS elements. 
I have a WBS of 5 level. 
I will create the PIR against WBS at 4th level.
Also, I will create the Sales order at 5th level WBS.
Now I need the sales order from 5th level WBS to consume the PIR from level 4th WBS.
Is it possible

entry.title: How to avoid creating condition records in SAP S4HANA?
entry.content:
When creating an order using transaction ME21N, a condition record is created which can be viewed using transaction ML35. We do not want this condition record to be created.

Checks performed:

In transaction OMFI, there is a default value Z1, which is configured so that prices are not transferred.

The user has the EVO parameter set to Z1, but condition records are still being created.

Does anyone know what other checks to perform?

Regards,

entry.title: Manual Cheque Number Assignment for Outgoing Payments
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

We are working on SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud 2023. is there any option for manual cheque number assignment for outgoing payments / cheque payment.

Our requirement:

  • We want to record the outgoing payment / supplier payment using the manual cheque number (instead of system-generated sequence).

  • We have already defined cheque lots in FCHI, but the system is still proposing cheque numbers automatically.

Questions:

  1. How can we configure cheque lots so that the system allows us to enter the cheque number manually while posting outgoing payments (F-58 or F110)?

  2. is there a way to override the system-generated cheque number with a manual one?

Any guidance, best practices, or SAP notes would be highly appreciated.

thanks & Regards,

silambarasan R

entry.title: How to create ODATA v4 POST API where it will take input as a structure and send back array of data
entry.content:
Dear Community,                                                                                                                                                                          I have a requirement where I want take a structure of fields as input and respond back with different structure or array of another structure/data. And this I want to create using ODATA v4 with latest ABAP. 

Can someone help me by providing some working sample piece of code and steps which needs to be followed?

I appreciate your response in advance.

Regards,                                                                                                                                                                             Omkar

entry.title: What is the release date for the GTS E4H 2025 version?
